title: SpaceX to launch European astronomy mission
summary: A European spacecraft is set to launch on a mission to help astronomers resolve an “embarrassing situation” in cosmology, although the launch itself is another kind of embarrassing situation for Europe.

title: Final member assigned to SpaceX and NASA’s Crew 7 mission
summary: The final member of Crew 7 has been announced, with Russian cosmonaut Konstantin Borisov joining as a mission specialist. Borisov joins NASA...

title: Space Development Agency issues new solicitation for 100 satellites
summary: The Space Development Agency on June 28 released a solicitation for bids for its next procurement of 100 satellites as the agency continues to build out a military constellation in low Earth orbit.

title: Firefly to launch Lockheed Martin small-satellite experiment
summary: Firefly Aerospace signed an agreement with Lockheed Martin to launch a small satellite aboard Firefly's Alpha vehicle.

title: Vega C Return to Flight Delayed After Z40 Test Failure
summary:
A static fire test of a Vega C Zefiro 40 (Z40) second stage conducted June 28 ended in failure. The successful completion of the test had been a requirement for Vega C to be cleared to return to flight later this year. In December 2022, the second launch of Avio’s Vega C rocket failed, resulting […]
The post Vega C Return to Flight Delayed After Z40 Test Failure appeared first on European Spaceflight.
